headline.print_headline: Saudis Fund Taliban and Back Government, Too
headline.main: Saudis Bankroll Taliban, Even as King Officially Supports Afghan Government

snippet: Saudi Arabia has voiced support for American efforts to nourish Afghanistan’s democracy, but it has also lavishly funded Sunni extremism under various guises....
abstract: Saudi Arabia has come to support conflicting sides of Afghanistan conflict, officially supporting American mission and Afghan government while also backing Pakistan's promotion of Taliban; dual loyalties, pursued through official policy and private initiative, feed conflicting needs within kingdom but may damage democracy there (Series: Secrets of the Kingdom).
lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia has voiced support for American efforts to nourish Afghanistan’s democracy, but it has also lavishly funded Sunni extremism under various guises.

byline.contributor: Ruhullah Khapalwak contributed reporting from Kabul.

headline.print_headline: Obama Expanding War With Al Qaeda to Include Somalia
headline.main: Obama Expands War With Al Qaeda to Include Shabab in Somalia

snippet: The administration’s move to stretch a 2001 war authorization will strengthen Donald J. Trump’s authority to combat thousands of Somali militants, and has drawn objections from some experts....
lead_paragraph: The administration’s move to stretch a 2001 war authorization will strengthen Donald J. Trump’s authority to combat thousands of Somali militants, and has drawn objections from some experts.

byline.original: By CHARLIE SAVAGE, ERIC SCHMITT and MARK MAZZETTI

headline.print_headline: 3 Benelux PMs in Tunisia to Talk Terrorism, Immigration
headline.main: 3 Benelux PMs in Tunisia to Talk Terrorism, Immigration

snippet: The prime ministers of Belgium, Netherlands, Luxembourg and Tunisia have agreed to cooperate more closely to counter terrorism, violent extremism and organized crime....
lead_paragraph: The prime ministers of Belgium, Netherlands, Luxembourg and Tunisia have agreed to cooperate more closely to counter terrorism, violent extremism and organized crime.

headline.print_headline: Putin Tells Erdogan Russia Ready to Increase Anti-Terrorism Cooperation: Kremlin
headline.main: Putin Tells Erdogan Russia Ready to Increase Anti-Terrorism Cooperation: Kremlin

snippet: Russian President Vladimir Putin told Turkey's Tayyip Erdogan in a telegram on Saturday that Russia was ready to increase cooperation against terrorism after a car bomb attack in the Turkish city of Kayseri, Russian news agencies reported....
lead_paragraph: Russian President Vladimir Putin told Turkey's Tayyip Erdogan in a telegram on Saturday that Russia was ready to increase cooperation against terrorism after a car bomb attack in the Turkish city of Kayseri, Russian news agencies reported.

headline.print_headline: UN: Gains Against Libya Terrorism Real but Not Irreversible
headline.main: UN: Gains Against Libya Terrorism Real but Not Irreversible

snippet: The fight against terrorism has produced results in Libya but those gains are not irreversible, the U.N.'s special envoy to the North African nation said Tuesday....
lead_paragraph: The fight against terrorism has produced results in Libya but those gains are not irreversible, the U.N.'s special envoy to the North African nation said Tuesday.

headline.print_headline: Egypt Reports Evidence of Explosives in Jet Crash
headline.main: Egypt Says Traces of Explosives Were Found on Bodies From Paris Flight

snippet: The announcement offered the strongest suggestion yet that a bomb might have brought down the airliner in May....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

abstract: Egyptian officials belatedly conclude that bomb may have caused crash of EgyptAir flight 804, which killed all 66 people on board; some suspect announcement was delayed for political reasons, as country continues to struggle with terrorism and its impact on tourism, which has gutted economy.
lead_paragraph: The announcement offered the strongest suggestion yet that a bomb might have brought down the airliner in May.

byline.contributor: Nour Youssef contributed reporting from Cairo, and Aurelien Breeden from Paris.

headline.print_headline: Obama Defends Record on Terrorism in National Security Speech
headline.main: Obama Defends Record on Terrorism in National Security Speech

snippet: President Barack Obama on Tuesday warned that the United States would not be able to wipe out terrorism with military might as he offered a sweeping defense of his administration's national security record....
lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama on Tuesday warned that the United States would not be able to wipe out terrorism with military might as he offered a sweeping defense of his administration's national security record.

headline.print_headline: Neo-Nazi Group Becomes First UK Far-Right Organization to Be Banned Under Terrorism Law
headline.main: Neo-Nazi Group Becomes First UK Far-Right Organization to Be Banned Under Terrorism Law

snippet: A neo-Nazi organization that praised the murderer of lawmaker Jo Cox has become the first far-right group in Britain to be banned as a terrorist organization, the Home Office said on Friday....
lead_paragraph: A neo-Nazi organization that praised the murderer of lawmaker Jo Cox has become the first far-right group in Britain to be banned as a terrorist organization, the Home Office said on Friday.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Torture Leaves a Legacy of Detainees With Damaged Minds
headline.main: How U.S. Torture Left a Legacy of Damaged Minds

snippet: Beatings, sleep deprivation, menacing and other brutal tactics have led to persistent mental health problems among detainees held in secret C.I.A. prisons and at Guantánamo....
abstract: Former Guantanamo Bay inmates and others who were once held in secret prisons operated by Central Intelligence Agency describe long-lasting psychological effects they have developed as result of harsh interrogation techniques they endured; legacy of such tactics impacts debate over morality and efficacy of practices; United States has yet to conduct study of psychological consequences.
lead_paragraph: Beatings, sleep deprivation, menacing and other brutal tactics have led to persistent mental health problems among detainees held in secret C.I.A. prisons and at Guantánamo.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jawad Sukhanyar from Kabul, Afghanistan; Rami Nazzal from Jerusalem; Nour Youssef from Cairo; Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon; Maher Samaan from Paris; Suliman Ali Zway from Berlin; and Karam Shoumali from Istanbul. Kitty Bennett and Alain Delaquérière contributed research.
byline.original: By MATT APUZZO, SHERI FINK and JAMES RISEN

headline.print_headline: Turkey Detains Brother of Fethullah Gulen, Cleric Accused of Plotting Coup
headline.main: Turkey Detains Brother of Fethullah Gulen, Cleric Accused of Plotting Coup

snippet: Kutbettin Gulen was said to have been arrested in the west of the country in connection with membership in an “armed terror organization.”...

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject

abstract: Turkish officials detain Kutbettin Gulen, brother of self-exiled cleric Fethullah Gulen, who is living in Pennsylvania and accused of organizing July coup attempt that left 271 dead in Turkey; Kutbettin Gulen, once significant ally of Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan, is suspected of connection with unnamed armed terrorist organization.
lead_paragraph: Kutbettin Gulen was said to have been arrested in the west of the country in connection with membership in an “armed terror organization.”

byline.contributor: Sewell Chan contributed reporting from London.
